description: {"blocks":[{"key":"533sc","text":"This protocol describes how to determine for a body of research articles, whether underlying datasets have been openly shared. Statements on shared data are detected within articles using the ODDPub text mining algorithm, and are then further processed using an openness extraction form implemented in Numbat. This extraction form was developed to guide and document the manual validation of automatedly detected Open Data statements. For one article, several datasets are checked, one per dataset location. The extraction form consists of checks of data availability and reusability, loosely inspired by the FAIR principles. The resulting table gives an overview of, amongst others, dataset location, applied license, and data formats. Data sharing in supplements, data reuse and restricted data sharing are also documented as alternatives to open data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":192,"length":6},{"key":1,"offset":302,"length":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"9dm36","text":"Operationalization of Open Data criteria has been described in the article preprint Operationalizing Open Data – Formulating verifiable criteria for the openness of datasets mentioned in biomedical research articles (Bobrov et al., 2023).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":84,"length":131}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F1424D60BBE211ECBE7399E387CE8095","url":"https://github.com/quest-bih/oddpub"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FBBB93A0BBE211ECBE7399E387CE8095","url":"https://numbat.bgcarlisle.com/"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C3ECD60787684EC997EC15592DC54D20","url":"https://doi.org/10.31222/osf.io/ajhs4"}}}}

steps.section: Automated validation of publications for statements indicating Open Data using ODDPub
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"403kv","text":"Collate a list of article identifiers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2v7qh","text":"Begin with a list of articles identifiers (usually DOIs), for which you want to assess the openness of the datasets underlying these articles. These idetifiers can typically be obtained by searching publication databases (e.g. Pubmed, Web of Science, OpenAlex, Dimensions, Embase) using the relevant search criteria and exporting the results with the relevant metadata fields.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":189,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d88o5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"438b","text":"Search criteria may include institutional affiliations of authors, specific research fields, specific journals, and typically, a publication date range. If the focus is on articles from a particular institution, a curated list of publications might be available directly from the institution (often provided by the institutional library).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":28,"length":37},{"style":"italic","offset":76,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":102,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":129,"length":22},{"style":"bold","offset":214,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bs2c2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"177jn","text":"The development and optimization of ODDPub (Open Data Detection in Publications) algorithm have been aligned with Open Data criteria, similar to those cited below. However, some changes in the criteria have been introduced over time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3lh89","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e7shh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"authors":"Evgeny Bobrov, Nico Riedel, Miriam Kip","can_edit":true,"created_on":"2024-05-01","date":0,"doi":"10.1162/qss_a_00301","guid":"0C9564DB651611EF8AD50A58A9FEAC02","journal":"Quantitative Science Studies, 2024; 5 (2): 383–407","protocol_guid":"","title":"Operationalizing open and restricted-access data—Formulating verifiable criteria for the openness of data sets mentioned in biomedical research articles"}}}}

steps.section: Automated validation of publications for statements indicating Open Data using ODDPub
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3s9u1","text":"Obtain the article full texts","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qia","text":"There are several options for this:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekusm","text":"via PubMed Central (Open Access articles)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"7rl59","text":"via  unpaywall API: the full-text links (Open Access articles).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":5,"length":13}],"data":{}},{"key":"7g8df","text":"via Publisher APIs: for full-text retrieval of subscription-based articles, offered by several major publishers, like Elsevier, Wiley, or Springer/Nature","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":118,"length":8},{"key":3,"offset":128,"length":5},{"key":4,"offset":138,"length":15}],"data":{}},{"key":"atiib","text":"via full-text R package: a solution that combines several of those data sources for downloading full texts. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":4,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ig5e","text":"These retrieval options are limited to articles that can be accessed as Open Access or through the subscription provided by the institution where the article are retrieved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afrc9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8gh7","text":"Store all retrieved article full-texts in a single folder either as PDFs (preferred for current ODDPub version) or as text files (e.g. XML).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"56834BA0AFFB11EC980A79BF8B1E5279","url":"https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/tools/openftlist/"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"4CB33DB0AFFB11EC980A79BF8B1E5279","url":"https://unpaywall.org/products/api"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"91D4FEB0AFFB11EC980A79BF8B1E5279","url":"https://dev.elsevier.com/"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B25834E0AFFB11EC980A79BF8B1E5279","url":"https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/library-info/resources/text-and-datamining"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CF332390AFFB11EC980A79BF8B1E5279","url":"https://www.springernature.com/gp/researchers/text-and-data-mining"}},"5":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FA903690AFFB11EC980A79BF8B1E5279","url":"https://github.com/ropensci/fulltext"}}}}

steps.section: Automated validation of publications for statements indicating Open Data using ODDPub
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9nn5r","text":"Apply ODDPub to article full texts","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lk7f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"816gb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ugh4","text":"The following steps describe how to use the ODDPub package in R.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":64}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":6,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1dij9","text":"ODDPub (Open Data Detection in Publications) is an open source text mining algorithm implemented in R. It screens articles for data sharing statements throughout the article, using keywords and keyword combinations. To use ODDPub, the publications must be prepared in PDF or text file format and stored in a local folder. Only full-text publications can screened. There is no limit on the number of publications. ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bpe04","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":11,"offset":29,"style":"bold"}],"key":"3sgd9","text":"The ODDPub workflow involves three steps:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":21,"style":"bold"}],"key":"6jq3o","text":"    1. Generation of text files out of PDF files (only if the full text is not already available in a text format, e.g. XML).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":28,"offset":22,"style":"bold"},{"length":8,"offset":61,"style":"bold"},{"length":93,"offset":126,"style":"italic"},{"length":37,"offset":223,"style":"italic"}],"key":"d9bir","text":"    2. Search for the data availability statements (DAS) and keywords (in and outside of DAS), defined in the script, such as repository names, accession-identifier-similar strings, pre-defined data sharing expressions, or references to supplementary material. Keywords can be found both within and across sentence boundaries, potentially spread throughout a paragraph.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":32,"offset":25,"style":"bold"}],"key":"atom7","text":"    3. Matching detected keywords and regular expressions from the script. If a keyword group is matched, the publication is categorized as containing Open Data.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e4aud","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":79,"offset":98,"style":"italic"},{"length":20,"offset":224,"style":"italic"}],"key":"7fu0c","text":"In addition to detecting Open Data statements, the algorithm detects the location of shared data (general-purpose repository, field-specific repository, supplement, data jorunal), as well as statements related to Open Code (open source software).","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"888ng","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":15,"offset":65,"style":"bold"},{"length":10,"offset":109,"style":"bold"},{"length":15,"offset":183,"style":"italic"},{"length":40,"offset":199,"style":"italic"},{"length":17,"offset":250,"style":"italic"},{"length":28,"offset":272,"style":"italic"}],"key":"ae37b","text":"Recent updates to ODDPub (v7.0.0) introduce distinctions between (own) Open Data (column \"is_open_data\") and Data Reuse (column \"is_reuse\") categories, along with new categories like \"upon request\", \"github\", and \"unknown/misspecified url\". Detected Data Availability and Code Availability statements are stored in separate columns.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"n3hq","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bqqb2","text":"For more information about ODDPub's implementation, see the following sources:","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ke2r","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"71mka","text":"1. steps.section: Different issue handling in Numbat - Admin access
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2tr7r","text":"The extraction process up to this point has been linear. Steps 9.1 to 9.4 outline optional procedures. Sometimes, it may be necessary to correct errors (9.1), or add one or more datasets to the extraction list. A new article entry can be uploaded to the existing Numbat list (9.2). If an extractor is unsure about the Open Data status of a dataset, the extraction can be reassigned to another extractor (9.3). Assessments from two or more extractors - whether for unclear cases or for quality assurance - can then be reconciled (9.4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"av5jl","text":"After installing ODDPub and organizing the PDFs, run the following command to start evaluation for Openness:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"10co7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"25qhl","text":"After screening, an output file in .csv format will be created in the same folder as the ODDPub script. You can change the format to any other type if needed (e.g. .txt, .tsv). Below is an example of the output from the latest ODDPub version (7.0.0). This output will be further validated manually in Numbat (see from the step 4).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":20,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":35,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76hd5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d353o","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8qapg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"command","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"can_edit":true,"command_name":"ODDPub Script","description":"A minimal R-Script to run the Open Data and Open Code detection via the ODDPub algorithm","guid":"47C5EA29341F11EE9D4302C0B41BC903","name":"library(tidyverse)
library(oddpub)

oddpub::pdf_convert("PDFs/", "PDFs_to_text/")
PDF_text <- oddpub::pdf_load("PDFs_to_text/")

oddpub_results <- oddpub::open_data_search(PDF_text)

#  Keep only actual DOIs in the data frame
oddpub_results$doi <- oddpub_results$doi %>%
str_remove(fixed(".txt")) %>%
str_replace_all(fixed("+"), "/") 

# Write results in CSV file
write_csv(oddpub_results, "oddpub_results.csv")","os_name":"ODDPub","os_version":"Version {"blocks":[{"key":"epkq7","text":"Select the 'Do extractions' option to begin extracting the Open Data status for publications where ODDPub has detected an Open Data statement (\"is_open_data\" = TRUE) by clicking on 'Extract'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":182,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2d48s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d7pm","text":"If there are multiple repositories, add a new sub-extraction for each repository after finishing the previous one.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ttq4","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6vb3m","text":"The extraction of other categories, such as \"is_reuse\" =TRUE or \"unknown url\", is optional and\nshould be based on the specific goals of the screening.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"video","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"CFAAD2F7345611EEAFD10A58A9FEAC02","height":0,"is_video":true,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"video/mp4","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Numbat_ ungeFAIR - Google Chrome 2022-03-21 10-15-56.mp4","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gyc4brgx7.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/gyc3brgx7.mp4","width":0}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4selc","text":"Open Data statement - Which ‘candidates’ are detected by ODDPub?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":64}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ct1v6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"chtoa","text":"Review the detected statement(s) for details such as repository information or accession codes. Be sware of potential false positives, which may include open code or statements completely unrelated to data sharing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7kh6o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duf2e","text":"The extraction form not only covers open data in the strict sense (freely accessible data) but also data under restricted access and the reuse of open data. It allows documentation of these practices without completing a full extraction.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":111,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":137,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"339qt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72jen","text":"Some reuse cases might lack a direct citation or referenceto the landing page in the article, even though they are indicated as a basis for the study provided by another institution or found in publicly accessible repositories. Where it is possible, answer all questions up to authorship. For cases where multiple criteria are challenging to assess, it is possible to document the reuse cases with the response \"Not checked (reuse)\".","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":5,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":381,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":277,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":411,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfqjk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24cgu","text":"To save time, you can skip extracting cases where it is clear that data have been reused or access is restricted. However, in many cases, this clarity emerges only during the detection process. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7il6f","text":"How to upload new article to an existing reference set (table):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1da48","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bo26","text":"1. Create a new .tsv document in your text editor. This document should include the same column names as your existing reference set and contain all the references (DOIs) that must be added.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e29cu","text":"2. Go to 'Manage reference set' --\u003e then 'Your set name XY' --\u003e and 'new reference'. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":68,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86ari","text":"3. Verify that the columns in the updated table match the existing ones .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d4vsg","text":"4. Assign the new records to one or more users via 'Manage user assignments'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":52,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Different issue handling in Numbat - Admin access
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fr0oc","text":"How to assign a questionable dataset to another extractor:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d5c7a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3qr31","text":"At the end of every extraction, there is an 'Assign to' option. Select the extractor(s) and the relevant extraction form (here: Openness), then finalize the assignment by clicking on 'Completed'. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":128,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":184,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ag7v8","text":"\nFor our use case, we assigned datasets to other extractors whenever the Open Data status was marked 'unsure'. Conversely, we did not reassign datasets if the status was clear to the first extractor (i.e., 'yes' or 'no').","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Different issue handling in Numbat - Admin access
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cvquh","text":"How to reconcile the answers of different extractors:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c931v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1orgo","text":"This function is essential when multiple extractors have worked on the same articles. If more than one extractor has completed the extraction, their answers can be compared and reconciled. Overlapping responses can be reconciled immediately, while differing responses may require further discussion or a decision based on the extractors' comments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1qs1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cml91","text":"Go to the 'Reconcile finished extractions' section.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sa6l","text":"The extractors who completed the extractions will be listed under the 'Extractors' column.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":71,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39lhr","text":"Click on 'Reconcile extractions': ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":10,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r438","text":"compare the answers of two or more extractors, which will be displayed in adjacent columns.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5rb31","text":"a discussion among the extractors may be necessary to reach a clear conclusion, unless one extractor is designated as the 'master extractor' and undertakes the final decision. Pay attention to the commentaries, as they may include valuable insights for decision-making.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpbon","text":"5. Save the selected answer in the final report by clicking 'Copy to final'. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":59,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu5c7","text":"6. The final copy can still be edited and enriched with additional comments if none of the original answers is fully satisfactory.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"310ik","text":"7. Copy each sub-extraction individually into the final copy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"116km","text":"7. As in the article extraction, ensure to click 'Completed' after finishing the reconciliation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":50,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3c6qt","text":"Search for other indications of Open Data missed by ODDPub","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":58}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"mebm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"399sv","text":"Although ODDPub is highly sensitive, it may still miss some Open Data statements, especially in fields less related to the biomedical field for which the workflow was developed and validated. To balance sensitivity and effort, it is recommended to review the article, focusing on the areas around the statements detected by ODDPub to check for any additional information that might have been missed. You can use keyword searches within the article to quickly locate the sections related to the ODDPub statements. If a statement appears to be a combination of different sections or sentences, use various keywords from the statement to access all detected sections.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":233,"length":33},{"style":"bold","offset":297,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":334,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgelb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"203js","text":"As new repositories and standard statements emerge, the frequency of missed Open Data statements may increase over time. Therefore, it is recommended (though not strictly necessary, depending on your use case) to briefly scan the article itself for further indications of shared datasets. Follow these steps:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":151,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hg21","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"alk9p","text":"Search for keywords such as \"data availability\", \"data sharing\", and \"data access\". If you find a section named \"data availability statement\" or similar, review the entire section for indications on shared data.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":29,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":50,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":70,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":113,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38ai6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c28lv","text":"  2. If no such section is found, use keywords like \"dataset\", \"data set\", \"access*\" and \"availab*\". Check all results with \u003c=10 hits for each keyword. Dismiss results where there are \u003e10 hits.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":53,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":64,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":76,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":90,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tkna","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"25dau","text":"  3. If no statement is found, search for the keyword \"data\"; if it yields \u003c=10 hits, review each result. If it yields \u003e10 hits, dismiss them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":55,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"enej8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"doets","text":"This procedure helps identify most datasets missed by ODDPub with minimal additional time investment. However, for a larger set of articles, this step may still be substantial, so consider implementing it only if missing datasets would significantly impact your use case.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1mp6u","text":"What is Numbat and how to install it","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"29tv7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4tror","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlvsf","text":"How to install Numbat (for Windows OS):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8g8er","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7eq67","text":"Requirements:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u7m0","text":"Apache HTTP Server","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3peka","text":"MySQL Database - provided by your company/organization","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amklj","text":"PHP","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6q0h0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98sbr","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7v4pc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0ikn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":6,"offset":0}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2708v","text":"Numbat is a tool designed for extracting information from primary sources to assist in writing systematic reviews within an academic context and managing the resulting databases. It allows for assigning extraction tasks to multiple raters and reconciling their outcomes, meaning that it can compare and consolidate these into a joint assessment.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8encr","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4glj9","text":"Key Numbat functionalities: ","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7059r","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8n7pj","text":"Create an extraction form (questionnaire) that corresponds to your needs, such as a list of questions about datasets. This form is applied to each record.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9h6np","text":"Import information detected from sources like ODDPub into Numbat in the form of a .tsv table, which contains the records you wish to validate.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fbs0b","text":"You can assign the dataset to multiple users if you want to compare extractions between raters, or assign it to a single responsible person.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cm1mv","text":"The final dataset, with all answers to the extraction form, can be exported as a table.","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"8hvom","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dq87g","text":"Numbat does not compute any statistics; its primary function is to collect information about records that would otherwise require fully manual entry without the aid of a semi-automated extraction form.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"883ji","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2s2np","text":"Numbat is built on PHP and is free and open-source software under the GNU AGPL v3 license.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"guid":"82E2CF71C61F11EC9FE10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/bgcarlisle/Numbat"},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"link"}}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":18,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8078n","text":"Installation on a server may require additional services and access rights; please contact your server's system administrator for assistance.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

Sign up'. You only need to provide your email address, password, and name. After registration, the Numbat admin will activate your account.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":17,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":178,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":68,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dohrq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evqi8","text":"User administration:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1g7bq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9h8rf","text":"As an admin of the Numbat instance, navigate to the 'User administration' section in the main menu. New users will appear with unverified email addresses. Verify their email addresses and assign the appropriate privileges - User or Admin. The descriptions of these privileges are provided on the same page.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":6,"length":6},{"style":"italic","offset":51,"length":23},{"style":"italic","offset":211,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":224,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":232,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8r72n","text":"The table below provides an overview of all Open Data criteria presented in the extraction form.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32lk5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h0bp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7b67t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4r6dg","text":"A quick video tutorial on how to do the extractions can be found under Section 5.1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":8,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"B_10":{"className":" "},"B_11":{"className":"_dt-italic"},"B_4":{"className":" "},"B_5":{"className":"_dt-italic"},"B_6":{"className":"_dt-italic"},"B_7":{"className":" "},"B_8":{"className":" "},"B_9":{"className":"_dt-italic"}},"colTitles":["question","answers"],"colWidths":["292","289.9977722167969"],"data":[["Is there a clear reference to available datasets in the publication?

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsdn3","text":"Embargoed data:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2jjli","text":"data that are not yet public but whose publication is planned and precisely specified on the existing dataset landing page.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a16t0","text":"they are documented through the \"Data under embargo\" button and can be validated after the embargo period ends.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":33,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4m6ch","text":"Handling the documentation of the data set publication date:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":60}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fe2s","text":"typically, use the last update date.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmmk2","text":"however, this can be confusing in some cases, as the last metadata update date may not correspond to the publication date. For example, in the Gene Expression Omnibus (GEO), the \"Status (public)\", \"Submission date\" and \"Last update date\" are usually three different dates. The entry most closely related to the publication date is the \"Status (public)\".","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":179,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":198,"length":15},{"style":"italic","offset":220,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":336,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cg6s6","text":"Genetic sequences and case reports:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3irei","text":"considered (open) data only when shared in a discipline-specific repository.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kpci","text":"Managing Access with Registration Requirements:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5olgk","text":"registration in a repository or databank should not be mandatory to access the data. If access is hindered in such way, it cannot be considered open access.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1birs","text":"simply clicking on an agreement without requiring registration is sufficient to meet the definition of open and free access.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5q9oj","text":"What does count to the 'best identifier'?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"90g63","text":"the best option for an identifier is a persistent one, such as a DOI or Handle.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":38,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lugr","text":"if both a URL and a DOI are available, the DOI should be documented as it is a more stable and persistent identifier. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ekprg","text":"for discipline-specific repositories that do not provide persistent identifiers, documenting the URL along with the accession number is the best approach.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6d5ad","text":"in cases like NCBI BioProject/SRA, link the project main page along with the corresponding SRA page leading to the data files. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bcd97","text":"non-persistent URLs, such as those from GitHub or the Open Science Framework without a DOI, are not sufficient as identifiers or data sources because not just metadata, but also data files can be changed by the data owners.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4b4a1","text":"supplements are generally considered insufficient unless they are stored independently of the article.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"560lo","text":"Which types of articles might produce data and therefore should not be excluded from the screening as potential sources of data?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":128}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ces1","text":"case report","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmqb1","text":"study protocol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e5h0o","text":"methodology","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"brtls","text":"short reports","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4sfd8","text":"systematic review","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1meid","text":"Own or Reuse data:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75hp6","text":"document both \"Own (Open) Data\" and \"Reused (Open) Data\" cases.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"926v","text":"typically, dataset metadata include author names, which can be compared with the article's authors to determine data ownership. In some cases, such as some of the NCBI repositories, the data owner may be listed only under an institution name. In such cases, if any author is affiliated with that institution, the dataset is considered \"own\" data.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"49p3u","text":"if neither author nor institution names are available, the article text (e.g., \"data were collected during...\") and context should help to clarify the data origin.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":80,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3rb7f","text":"reuse statements are often found outside the \"Data Availability Statement\".","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dnf2c","text":"reuse of the datasets generated by other researchers is not considered Open Data per default, but need a separate verification for openness.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":140}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8l89v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4smi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"astp7","text":"Criteria for restricted or reuse cases:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hf9r","text":"criteria for repository requirements and accessibility may vary for restricted data sets. A URL to the location or page where the data can be requested (rather than a general \"upon request\" statement in the article) is sufficient.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":176,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp554","text":"the same approach applies to the reuse of restricted data sets.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6kh4n","text":"Are classifieds (models) for ML training raw data?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0sp0","text":"classifiers for machine learning algorithms are not considered raw data according to our definition.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5582o","text":"Systematic reviews:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5plue","text":"should include more than just a list of referenced publications; they should also provide extracted information and clearly outline the exclusion and inclusion criteria.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4q8m8","text":"Are genomics summary statistics the same as other summary statistics?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":69}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68pf4","text":"generally, summary statistics are not considered raw or unprocessed data. However, genomics summary statistics stored in specialized repositories, such as the GWAS Catalog, differ from typical summary statistics. They represent a collection of studies and are not directly comparable to standard statistics.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ca9od","text":"Pharma data:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bstnk","text":"researchers may collaborate with or be part of a pharmaceutical company, but the primary consideration is whether the data is stored on an academic platform/database/repository or at a pharmaceutical company (e.g., Vivli, Yoda). ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"669i2","text":"mention of pharmaceutical platforms in the article indicates that the data are more likely to be stored outside academic repositories, and such cases are treated separately from common (academic) open data cases.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3hlm4","text":"What does not count as a 'clear reference'?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ke4q","text":"according to the current criteria (Bobrov, et al. 2024, 10.1162/qss_a_00301) supplements are not considered Open Data, partly because they are not shared independantly from the article.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":56,"length":19}],"data":{}},{"key":"151vn","text":"reference to data shared within the manuscript, without explicitely mentioning the word 'supplement', are also not sufficient.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ct0t9","text":"references to data presented in tables within articles do not qualify as clear references to raw data.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7kv3","text":"reference to data upon reuqest by the authors is do not qualify as clear references to raw data.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5C859662DB5947D487A24C4AD1462140","url":"https://doi.org/10.1162/qss_a_00301"}}}}
